titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Harvey Fierstein Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Scott Libson and Camila Zorrilla Tessler

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 07:16

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection documents Harvey Fierstein as author, actor, and gay activist. The papers include scripts, professional correspondence, publicity materials, clippings, legal documents, scrapbooks, photographs, audio recordings, and videotapes.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

The computer files are unprocessed and may contain sensitive information or be in a physical state that would prohibit use. Researchers wishing to request access should email mssa.assist@yale.edu . The request should outline the scope and purpose of the research project, why the researcher believes the material is relevant to their project, and contact information. If possible the request should also include a list of specific material of interest including collection, box, and folder numbers (or folder descriptions if folders are not numbered). The review may take several weeks.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the creator of this collection for materials he has authored or otherwise produced. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Harvey Fierstein Papers (MS 1864). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in five series and four additions: I. Writings, 1972-2005. II. Performances, 1966-2006. III. Topical, 1896, 1919-2005 (inclusive), 1967-2005 (bulk). IV. Clippings, 1971-2005. V. Audiovisual, 1966-2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection primarily documents the professional career of Harvey Fierstein as noted writer and performer. Files of writings, topical files, clippings, and audiovisual materials additionally illuminate the theater industry as a whole, particularly the production of plays ranging from independent, low-budget productions to major theatrical endeavors, and how the media has depicted a prominent gay artist in the late twentieth century. There is also documentation related to the political and social causes in which Fierstein has been involved.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Harvey Fierstein, award-winning playwright, actor and gay rights activist, was born on June 6, 1954, in Brooklyn, New York. He received his B.F.A. from the Pratt Institute in 1973. Aware of his sexuality as a young man, he appeared as a female impersonator in Manhattan nightclubs in his early teens. His career as an actor began in 1971 when he had the lead role as a lesbian maid in Andy Warhol's Pork . His first play, In Search of the Cobra Jewels , was produced in 1973. The International Stud , the first of three plays that eventually comprised the Torch Song Trilogy , was produced in 1976. Followed by Fugue in a Nursery and Widows and Children First , the trilogy won two Tonys, and was made into a movie, starring Fierstein, in 1988. Fierstein also won Tonys for his book for the musical La Cage aux Folles and for his role in the Broadway production of Hairspray . He has appeared in more than ten movies, and his voice has been featured on The Simpsons television show and in the Disney animated film, Legends of Mulan . His appearances on television include the 1994-1995 series, Daddy's Girls , and Family Guy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by title. Files include scripts (arranged chronologically within title), clippings, photographs, contracts, programs, and promotional material relating to Fierstein's work as an author of Broadway plays, movie screenplays, and television scripts. It is probable that some of the titles herein were not published or produced. Folder headings are largely derived from Fierstein's own titles.

did.unittitle: All for You [formerly Frankie and Johnny Were Lovers]
Cannibals Just Don't Know No Better

odd.p: See also: Series I. Writings, 1972-2005 Folder 147

odd.p: See also: Series V. Audiovisual, 1966-2004 Box 60

In the Shadow of the Cyclone [scenario for a screenplay]
A Mystery for Our Times, TV Guide
Not on My Network You Don't
Now You're Cookin' [also known as Harvey; scripts]
The Park Girls [also known as Formerly the Park Girls and Singing Sisters]
Copyrights [includes scripts of Torch Song Trilogy and Forget Him]
This is Not Going to be Pretty
Los Angeles Drama Critics Circle plaque
Fierstein v New Line, et al.
What Makes Me Angry, National Lampoon
Articles, short stories, poetry, and untitled

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains materials relating to plays, musicals, and television shows in which Fierstein performed but did not write. Materials are arranged alphabetically, primarily by title, and include clippings, correspondence, programs, publicity materials, and scripts. Folder headings are largely derived from Fierstein's own folders.

did.unittitle: The Little Matchgirl Makes it Big
One Man's Religion and The Pinotti Papers
The Pioneer and Pro-Game [includes other Megan Terry materials]
Playhouse of the Ridiculous [Persia and Satyricon]
Theatre of the Last Continent [Vinyl Visits an FM Station and Boy on the Straight-Back Chair]
Xircus! The Private Life of Jesus Christ

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series is arranged alphabetically. Files relate to causes for which Fierstein has advocated, the theater industry in general, and there is a small amount of personal and biographical material on Fierstein. Plays are comprised of three scripts, which were written by others and in which Fierstein did not act. Collected musical scores, dating as early as 1896, are filed under music. Folder headings are largely derived from Fierstein's own folders.

did.unittitle: Friends and Advocates for Individual Rights (FAIRPAC)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series is arranged in three groups: Audio, Video, and Photographs. Audio and Video are arranged alphabetically by title. They primarily document productions in which Fierstein performed. Photographs are divided into three subgroups: Fierstein alone, Fierstein with others, and others. Most photographs are unidentified. Note that photographs may also be found in Series I and Series II.

Ma's house, opening, dinner, porch, shiva (sp?) [Commercially produced]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This addition consists primarily of scripts, programs, and other production materials from productions that Fierstein produced, wrote, or featured in as a performer. Also includes press clippings from these same productions and some of Fierstein's writings regarding a variety of topics, including theater and LGBTQ+ rights.

This addition also contains legal and financial papers, contracts and press clippings and correspondence regarding the New Line lawsuit, when Fierstein sued New Line cinema for changes made to the Torch Song Trilogy when it was aired on television.
Material in this addition ranges from 1970-2015, with the bulk of the material ranging between 1990 and 2010.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This addition is arranged in alphabetical order, with materials related to specific productions organized under the title of the production.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The computer files are unprocessed and may contain sensitive information or be in a physical state that would prohibit use. Researchers wishing to request access should email mssa.assist@yale.edu . The request should outline the scope and purpose of the research project, why the researcher believes the material is relevant to their project, and contact information. If possible the request should also include a list of specific material of interest including collection, box, and folder numbers (or folder descriptions if folders are not numbered). The review may take several weeks.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy of non-commercially produced items for their personal use should consult the ordering reproductions information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.
